extendedIngredients.name: sun-dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drain slightly, on paper towel and chop
metaInformation: packed in oil, drain slightly, on paper towel and chop

recipes.title: Spinach Salad With Pecans and Sun-Dried Tomato

winePairing.pairingText: Salad works really well with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: 1 Saute the mushrooms, set aside and keep warm.2 Place spinach, pecans and chopped sun-dried tomatoes in a medium bowl, toss evenly.3 Add warm mushrooms, lightly toss again.4 Add vinegar/oil mixture, toss to coat.5 Serve immediately.6 The quantities of vinegar, raspberry olive oil, salt and pepper: Whisk small amount, taste, and adjust to your liking.

steps.step: Saute the mushrooms, set aside and keep warm.2
Place spinach, pecans and chopped sun-dried tomatoes in a medium bowl, toss evenly.3
Add warm mushrooms, lightly toss again.4
Add vinegar/oil mixture, toss to coat.5
